note_content:
Session Note - March 5, 2026
Patient: Sarah Chen
Therapist: Dr. Rebecca Torres, PsyD

Presenting Concerns:
Patient reports ongoing generalized anxiety with persistent worry about job performance and family responsibilities. Anxiety severity is moderate, with symptoms present for approximately six months. Reports difficulty concentrating at work as a secondary concern. Identified work deadlines and family conflict as primary triggers.

Session Summary:
Focused on cognitive behavioral therapy techniques to address catastrophic thinking about work performance. Patient identified three automatic negative thoughts and practiced cognitive restructuring with therapist guidance. Completed a brief relaxation training exercise. Patient demonstrated improved ability to challenge distorted thinking compared to previous sessions.

Mood Assessment:
Current mood: 6/10 (worried but managing)
Mood stability: Stable compared to last session
Energy level: Normal
Emotional themes include worry and determination.
Affect observed: Anxious
Affect congruence: Congruent with reported mood

Mental Status Examination:
Appearance: Well-groomed and appropriately dressed
Behavior: Cooperative and engaged throughout session
Speech: Normal rate, rhythm, and volume
Thought process: Linear and goal-directed
Thought content: Preoccupied with work performance concerns
Perception: No abnormalities noted
Cognition: Intact, alert and oriented
Insight: Good - able to recognize connection between thoughts and anxiety
Judgment: Good

Risk Assessment:
Suicidal ideation: None. Self-harm: None. Homicidal ideation: None. Risk level: Low. Safety plan: Not needed.

Interventions Used:
- Cognitive restructuring
- Relaxation training
- Psychoeducation about anxiety cycle
Techniques were effective - patient reported decreased anxiety by end of session.
Skills taught: Thought challenging worksheet, diaphragmatic breathing
Homework assigned: Complete thought diary entries daily and practice breathing exercises twice per day
Previous homework: Partially completed - did breathing exercises but missed some diary entries
Medications: Not applicable, not on psychotropic medications

Diagnoses:
Primary diagnosis: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
Primary diagnosis code: F41.1
Diagnosis status: No change from previous session

Treatment Progress:
Overall progress: Some improvement in anxiety management skills
Treatment phase: Middle
Barriers: Difficulty maintaining consistent practice between sessions
Strengths: Strong motivation and good therapeutic alliance
Treatment goals: Reduce anxiety to manageable levels, develop reliable coping toolkit
Goals addressed this session: Cognitive restructuring skill development

Plan:
- Continue weekly sessions
- Next session: March 12, 2026
- Focus next session on exposure hierarchy development
- No referrals needed
- Level of care: Outpatient
- Discharge planning: Not planned
